medical_history.chief_complaint: 6-day history of mild right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain, poor oral intake, and hypotension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6 days ago after a rich meal for a family celebration, leading to feelings of fullness and unwellness. RUQ abdominal pain was present, relieved by antacids. The patient has taken very little by mouth since then. Loose stools occurred but were managed with Immodium, resulting in no stooling for the 2 days prior to presentation. Hypotension and dizziness developed over the last two days, with a reported blood pressure of 80/38.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, glucose intolerance, osteoarthritis, hypothyroidism, atrioventricular nodal reentrant tachycardia (AVNRT) on verapamil and atenolol, history of skin cancer (squamous cell carcinoma of the nose), non-bleeding grade 3 hemorrhoids, erosive gastritis, and transitional carcinoma of the bladder treated locally without recurrence.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes breast cancer in a sister and maternal aunt.
